java Funny
pause

Assuming your compiled files are located in the ‘bin’ folder.

item.title: Code
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

You’re over thinking this Deven.

import java.util.*;

public class Funny {
	public static String height = "";
	public static String weight = "";

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		System.out.println("Let's start the game :P");
		height();
		weight();
		age();
	}

	public static void height() {
		System.out.println("What is your height? (In feet please)");
		Scanner heigh = new Scanner(System.in);
		int height = heigh.nextInt();
		if (height <= 5) {

			System.out.println("Oh shit, You're a midget! " + height
					+ "Feet,  LOL big people, your world.");
		} else if (height >= 6) {

			System.out.println("Oh fuck you tall son of a bitch..... Dam, "
					+ height + "Feet tall... What the fuck.");
		}
	}

	public static void weight() {
		System.out.println("What is your weight ?");
		Scanner weigher = new Scanner(System.in);
		int weight = weigher.nextInt();
		if (weight >= 200)
			;
		System.out.println("Okay Mr. " + weight
				+ " Pounds, *COUGH* Fatass *COUGH*");
		if (weight <= 100)
			;
		System.out.println("Jesus you fucking stick! How the fuck are you "
				+ weight + "Pounds!!");
		System.out.println("Average faggot.");
	}

	public static void age() {
		System.out.println("Hey fag, please tell me your age.");
		Scanner ager = new Scanner(System.in);
		int age = ager.nextInt();
		System.out.println("Okay, So let me get this straight, you're "
				+ height + "feet tall," + weight + "pounds, and " + age
				+ " years old....");
		System.out.println("Calculating Information...");
		System.out.println("...");
		System.out.println("You're a: Faggot.");
	}

	public static void end() {
		int number = 9;
		System.out
				.println("But! There is one way you can not be a complete faggot.");
		System.out.println("All you have to do is guess the number.");
		System.out.println("Now what do you think the number is?");
		Scanner secretnumber = new Scanner(System.in);
	}
}

item.title: Code
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

In the Java programming language, the final keyword is used in several different contexts to define an entity which cannot later be changed.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Final_(Java)

Remove the final keyword as it has no purpose to be a constant.

Read full topic

item.title: Code
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

You never initialized your string variables. If your using eclipse, press CTRL + A, then CTRL+SHIFT+F to format, now it should look like this:

import java.util.*;

public class Funny {

	public static final String HEIGHT = "";
	public static final String WEIGHT = "";

	public static void main(String[] args) {

		System.out.println("Let's start the game :P");
		height();
		weight();
		age();
	}

	public static void height() {
		System.out.println("What is your height?");
		Scanner heigh = new Scanner(System.in);
		int height = heigh.nextInt();
		System.out.println("Oh shit, You're a midget! " + height
				+ "Feet,  LOL big people, your world.");
	}

	public static void weight() {
		System.out.println("What is your weight ?");
		Scanner weigher = new Scanner(System.in);
		int weight = weigher.nextInt();
		System.out.println("Okay Mr. " + weight
				+ " Pounds, *COUGH* Fatass *COUGH*");
	}

	public static void age() {
		System.out.println("Hey fag, please tell me your age.");
		Scanner ager = new Scanner(System.in);
		int age = ager.nextInt();
		System.out.println("Okay, So let me get this straight, you're "
				+ height + "feet tall," + weight + "pounds, and " + age
				+ " years old....");
		System.out.println("Calculating Information...");
		System.out.println("...");
		System.out.println("You're a: Faggot.");
	}
}

All final variables need to be in all caps like above. Why are you using strings for those variables anyway? Those should be a numerical type…

IMO, you could include all of these in the main method, using ONE scanner, that way you wouldn’t have this issue.

Read full topic

" + height + "Feet, LOL big people, your world."); } public static void weight(){ System.out.println("What is your weight ?"); Scanner weigher = new Scanner(System.in); int weight = weigher.nextInt(); System.out.println("Okay Mr. " + weight + " Pounds, *COUGH* Fatass *COUGH*"); } public static void age() { System.out.println("Hey fag, please tell me your age."); Scanner ager = new Scanner(System.in); int age = ager.nextInt(); System.out.println("Okay, So let me get this straight, you're " + height + "feet tall," + weight + "pounds, and " + age + " years old...."); System.out.println("Calculating Information..."); System.out.println("..."); System.out.println("You're a: Faggot."); } }
